definition: reluctant to part (idiom); broken-hearted at having to leave
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: They thus coming tunnel don ¡ x't.
sentences.chinese: 两人就这样依依不舍地道了别。

sentences.english: I am attached to my family.
After a while, it crawled unwillingly back into the river.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，大白龟才依依不舍地往河里爬去。

sentences.english: They certainly in the hearts of Liyuan reluctant to part with the sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 他们的心里一定充满了对荔园依依不舍的情感。

sentences.english: Teachers and students were reluctant to bid farewell to Premier Wen. The Just-one-hour interactions left them with a beautiful memory.
sentences.chinese: 师生们与温总理依依不舍地道别。

sentences.english: When it is time to leave, you will go reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 当你该起程回家时，你会依依不舍。

sentences.english: As paper receipts disintegrate, some people are a bit wistful.
sentences.chinese: 伴随着纸质发票的消失，也有一些人觉得依依不舍。

sentences.english: We came home from school late that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天，我们较晚才离开学校，依依不舍。

definition: reluctant to part with (sth or sb)/unwilling to let go of
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
to follow with one's eyes (a departing guest etc)
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
